001package com.telos.loops.error;
002
003/**
004 * Thrown when the Loops API rate limit has been exceeded (HTTP 429).
005 *
006 * <p>This exception is raised when you've made too many requests to the Loops API within a given
007 * time window. The API returns an HTTP 429 status code along with a "Retry-After" header
008 * indicating when you can retry the request.
009 *
010 * <h2>Rate Limit Information</h2>
011 *
012 * <p>The Loops API enforces rate limits to ensure fair usage and system stability. When you exceed
013 * these limits, this exception provides the number of seconds to wait before retrying.
014 *
015 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
016 *
017 * <pre>{@code
018 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
019 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
020 *         .build();
021 *
022 * try {
023 *     client.contacts().create(request);
024 * } catch (RateLimitExceededException e) {
025 *     long waitSeconds = e.retryAfterSeconds();
026 *     System.err.println("Rate limit exceeded. Retry after " + waitSeconds + " seconds.");
027 *     System.err.println("Status Code: " + e.statusCode());
028 *
029 *     // Option 1: Wait and retry
030 *     Thread.sleep(waitSeconds * 1000);
031 *     client.contacts().create(request);  // Retry
032 *
033 *     // Option 2: Schedule retry for later
034 *     scheduler.schedule(() -> {
035 *         client.contacts().create(request);
036 *     }, waitSeconds, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
037 * } catch (LoopsApiException e) {
038 *     System.err.println("API error: " + e.getMessage());
039 * }
040 * }</pre>
041 *
042 * <h2>Retry Behavior</h2>
043 *
044 * <p>The SDK does not automatically retry rate-limited requests. It's the caller's responsibility
045 * to implement retry logic with appropriate backoff. Always respect the {@link #retryAfterSeconds}
046 * value to avoid further rate limiting.
047 *
048 * <p><b>Best Practices:</b>
049 *
050 * <ul>
051 *   <li>Implement exponential backoff for retries
052 *   <li>Respect the retry-after duration from {@link #retryAfterSeconds()}
053 *   <li>Consider implementing a request queue with rate limiting
054 *   <li>Monitor your API usage to avoid hitting limits
055 * </ul>
056 *
057 * @see LoopsApiException
058 * @see LoopsValidationException
059 */
060public class RateLimitExceededException extends LoopsApiException {
061  private final long retryAfterSeconds;
062
063  /**
064   * Constructs a new RateLimitExceededException from an HTTP 429 response.
065   *
066   * @param statusCode the HTTP status code (typically 429)
067   * @param rawBody the raw response body from the API
068   * @param retryAfterSeconds the number of seconds to wait before retrying, from the Retry-After
069   *     header
070   */
071  public RateLimitExceededException(int statusCode, String rawBody, long retryAfterSeconds) {
072    super(statusCode, rawBody);
073    this.retryAfterSeconds = retryAfterSeconds;
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Returns the number of seconds to wait before retrying the request.
078   *
079   * <p>This value comes from the "Retry-After" header in the API response. Callers should wait at
080   * least this long before making another request to avoid further rate limiting.
081   *
082   * @return the retry-after duration in seconds
083   */
084  public long retryAfterSeconds() {
085    return retryAfterSeconds;
086  }
087}
